documents.name: Terms of Use
documents.text:
<div class="browser-compatibility-alert">. <i class="fa fa-exclamation-triangle fa-2x pull-left"></i>. <p class="browser-error">Your browser's Javascript functionality is turned off. Please turn it on so that you can experience the full capabilities of this site.</p>. </div>. Terms of Use Terms of Use

1800Mattress.com Internet Site Terms and Conditions

Welcome to the 1800Mattress.com Internet site (the "Site"). The Site is owned and operated by 1800Mattress. This page contains the 1800Mattress.com Internet Site Terms and Conditions of Use (these "Terms &. Conditions"). The Site is made available only to those who agree to these Terms &. Conditions. As such, these Terms &. Conditions govern and control your access to and use of the Site and by accessing and using the Site you are agreeing to be bound by these Terms &. Conditions. If you do not agree to be bound by these Terms &. Conditions, you are not authorized to use the Site. 1800Mattress.com may change these Terms &. Conditions from time to time, without notice to you, by posting such changes on the Site. By using the Site following any such changes, you agree to be bound by these Terms &. Conditions as they may have been changed.

1.   The Site and 1800Mattress.com Business. 1800Mattress.com is the operator of retail mattress stores for consumers ("Customers"). Our credit card underwriters may operate sites embedded within the Site. Such sites may be governed by separate or additional terms and conditions.

2.   Compliance with Laws. Use of the Site is subject to compliance with all applicable international, federal, state and local laws and regulations.

3.   Collection of Certain Information. The Site may include functions (such as "contact us", forms for employment applications and registration information or "feedback" pages) provided for the purpose of submitting information to 1800Mattress.com. Submitted information may include personally identifiable information such as names and e-mail addresses. 1800Mattress.com handling and use of all submitted information will be pursuant to the 1800Mattress.com Privacy Policy published separately on the Site.

4.   Your Account and Password. If you are required to establish or use an account on the Site (whether or not as a Customer) and have been provided with a user name and password for such purpose, you are responsible for maintaining the strict confidentiality of that information. You are also responsible for any activity conducted under your account. You agree to: (a) immediately notify 1800Mattress.com of any unauthorized use of your password or account or any other breach of the Site’s security. and (b) ensure that you log-off and exit from your account at the end of each session. It is your sole responsibility to control the dissemination and use of your password, and control access to and use of your account. It is also your sole responsibility to notify 1800Mattress.com if you desire to cancel your account on the Site. 1800Mattress.com will not be responsible or liable for any loss or damage arising from your failure to comply with this provision.

5.   Rights to Site Content. As between 1800Mattress.com and Site visitors, 1800Mattress.com is the sole and exclusive owner of all intellectual property rights, proprietary rights and moral rights in and to the Site content including, without limitation, all text, graphics and photographs located within the Site.

6.   Prohibited Conduct. The Site may not be used in any manner that is unlawful or harmful to the rights of 1800Mattress.com, any Customer or any third party. In no event shall you use the Site in a manner that exceeds the specific authorization granted by 1800Mattress.com under these Terms &. Conditions or by other express written agreement. The prohibition on unauthorized uses includes (but is not limited to) an express prohibition any attempt to: (a) retrieve, alter, or destroy data on, from or through the Site. (b) probe, scan or test the vulnerability of a system or network on, from or through the Site. or (c) breach or defeat system or network security measures on, from or through the Site such as authentication, authorization, confidentiality, intrusion detection, or monitoring. (d) interfere with or disrupt the Site or the business, operations or services of 1800Mattress.com. (e) interfere with or disrupt any computer, host, network, or telecommunications device maintained by 1800Mattress.com or any third party. (f) interfere with or disrupt the legitimate use of the Site by any person. (g) transmit, distribute, disseminate, publish or store any information that is in violation of any applicable law or regulation or is defamatory, abusive, obscene, indecent, or harassing, or that threatens or encourages injury to persons or property or infringement of the lawful rights of 1800Mattress.com or any other party. (h) violate the privacy rights of 1800Mattress.com or any other party under applicable law or regulation. (i) use any technology that is or reasonably should be known to contain software viruses, Trojan horses, or any computer code, files, or programs designed to disrupt, destroy, invade, gain unauthorized access to, corrupt, observe, or modify without authorization, any data, software, computing or network devices, or telecommunications equipment of 1800Mattress.com or any Customer or any other third party. (j) use the facilities of the Site to send, relay, forward, bounce, reply, or otherwise route commercial or non-commercial unsolicited electronic messages (commonly referred to as "spam") or commercial electronic messages even if previously solicited by the intended recipient. and (k) copy (whether directly or by use of any "scraping" or related technology) any of the contents of the Site.

7.   Links. The Site may include links to other Internet sites over which 1800Mattress.com has no control. These links are provided solely as a convenience to users of the Site. You acknowledge and agree that 1800Mattress.com is not responsible for the availability of the sites intended to be located at such links, and that 1800Mattress.com does not endorse (and is not responsible or liable for) any such linked sites including their content, advertising, products, or other materials. You further acknowledge and agree that, under no circumstances, will 1800Mattress.com be held responsible or liable, directly or indirectly, for any loss or damage that is caused or alleged to have been caused to you in connection with your use of, or reliance on, any content, advertisements, products or other resources available on any other Internet site (regardless of whether the Site is directly or indirectly linked to such content, advertisements, products or other resources). You should direct any concerns with respect to any other Internet site to that Internet site’s administrator or webmaster.

8.   DISCLAIMER OF WARRANTIES. THE SITE AND ALL INFORMATION CONTAINED ON IT IS PROVIDED "AS IS" WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE OR NON-INFRINGEMENT. 1800Mattress.com MAKES NO WARRANTIES WITH RESPECT TO THE ACCURACY OR COMPLETENESS OF INFORMATION CONTAINED ON THE SITE, OR THAT THE SITE WILL BE ERROR-FREE OR AVAILABLE FOR UNINTERRUPTED USE. NO ADVICE, RESULTS OR INFORMATION, WHETHER ORAL OR WRITTEN, OBTAINED BY YOU FROM 1800Mattress.com THROUGH THE SITE SHALL CREATE ANY WARRANTY. IF YOU ARE DISSATISFIED WITH THE SITE, YOUR SOLE REMEDY IS TO DISCONTINUE USING THE SITE. YOU SHOULD NOT RELY ON THE SITE TO MAINTAIN ANY SUBMISSIONS YOU MAY MAKE. YOU SHOULD RETAIN ALL SUCH DATA AND INFORMATION IN YOUR OWN RECORDS FOR USE IN THE EVENT THAT THE SITE FAILS OR IS UNAVAILABLE, OR THE DATA OR INFORMATION IS LOST.

9.   Indemnification &. Limitation of Liability. You agree to defend, indemnify and hold 1800Mattress.com and each of its subsidiary, affiliated and related entities, and each of their respective directors, officers, members, shareholders, employees and suppliers (collectively the "1800Mattress.com Parties"), harmless from any and all claims, liabilities, costs and expenses, including reasonable legal fees, arising in any way from your use or misuse of the Site or your breach or violation of the law or of these Terms &. Conditions. You agree that the 1800Mattress.com Parties shall not have any liability to you under any theory of liability or indemnity in connection with your use of the Site. You hereby release and forever waive any and all claims you may have against the 1800Mattress.com Parties for losses or damages you sustain in connection with your use of the Site. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE 1800Mattress.com PARTIES BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES, WHETHER DIRECT, INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE, EXEMPLARY, SPECIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL (INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, FOR LOST PROFITS, BUSINESS INTERRUPTION, LOSS OF INFORMATION, PROGRAMS OR DATA), RESULTING FROM ACCESS TO, USE OF, OR INABILITY TO USE THE SITE, OR DUE TO ANY BREACH OF SECURITY ASSOCIATED WITH THE TRANSMISSION OF INFORMATION VIA THE INTERNET, EVEN IF THE 1800Mattress.com PARTIES WERE ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES AND WHETHER ARISING UNDER THEORY OF CONTRACT, TORT (INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE), STRICT LIABILITY OR OTHERWISE.

10.   Applicable Laws. These Terms &. Conditions shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York without regard to principles of conflicts of laws. All proceedings relating to the Site or these Terms &. Conditions shall be brought in the state or federal courts located in the State of New York and you hereby irrevocably consent to the personal and exclusive jurisdiction of such courts. 1800Mattress.com controls and operates this Site from its offices in New York in the United States of America. 1800Mattress.com does not represent that materials on the Site are appropriate or available for use in other locations. Persons who choose to access this Site from other locations do so on their own initiative, and are responsible for compliance with local laws, if and to the extent applicable.

11.   General. You agree that regardless of any statute or law to the contrary, any claim or cause of action by you arising out of or related to use of the Site or the Terms &. Conditions must be filed by you within one (1) year after such claim or cause of action arose or be forever barred. Should any provision of these Terms &. Conditions be held to be void, invalid, unenforceable or illegal by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remaining provisions hereof shall remain in full force and effect. The waiver of any breach or default of these Terms &. Conditions will not constitute a waiver of any subsequent breach or default, and will not act to amend or negate the rights of the waiving party. These Terms &. Conditions constitute the complete agreement of the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof, and supersede all prior agreements and understandings in relation thereto.

TOP OF PAGE

Find Your MatchMattressesBed Frames &. FurnitureBeddingPillowsMattress OutletSale Privacy Policy Mattress Firm Privacy Policy Last updated: December 31, 2022

Mattress Firm, Inc. and its brands, including Sleep Experts and Sleep.com (collectively, “Mattress Firm,” “we,” “us” and “our”), are committed to making your search for the perfect mattress and a great night’s sleep as pleasurable and easy as possible. Maintaining your privacy is part of that commitment. By interacting with Mattress Firm through our stores, websites, customer service desk, MattressMatcher® application, mobile applications, events, products, and services, you expressly consent to the collection and use of information about you as described in this Privacy Policy. We may change or add to this Privacy Policy, so we encourage you to view it periodically. This Privacy Policy is made available to you for information purposes only and is not a contract between you and Mattress Firm.

If you are looking for information about how we collect personal data from our employees, please review the Employee Privacy Notice. What is Not Covered by this Privacy Policy? If you applied for a Mattress Firm credit card or any other financing or leasing at our stores, events, online, or on your mobile device, this Privacy Policy does not apply to information that you submitted in your application, which was collected by a third-party on behalf of our financing and leasing partners, not Mattress Firm. These partners have their own privacy policies, which we encourage you to review before you submit your application. You may contact our financing and leasing partners directly for information on their privacy policies and for detail on how they use your personal information.

Our stores, websites, applications, events, and services are intended for general audiences only and are not directed at persons outside of the United States or at children less than 16 years of age. We do not knowingly collect personal information from persons outside of the United States or from children under 16 years of age.

If you are an employee or have applied for a job with us, you can review our Employment Privacy Statement here, which describes information that we collect and use for employment purposes. Types of Information We Collect About You During the past year, we have collected the following information about our guests and others. We may collect such information about you:


Categories of Information
Information


Identifiers
Name

Signature

Postal address

Email address

Date of birth

Account login

Account password

Telephone number

Driver’s license number or state identification card number

Vehicle license plate number

Bank account number

Credit/debit card account number

Comfort and sleep environment preferences

Special status designation (e.g., first-responder, military, etc.)

Tax identification number


Commercial information
Records of products or services purchased, obtained, or considered, or other purchasing or consuming histories or tendencies


Internet or other electronic network activity
Internet or other electronic network activity information, including, but not limited to, browsing time, browsing history, search history, and information regarding your interaction with an internet web site, application, or advertisement


Geolocation data
Geolocation data (not more precise than your zip code)

IP address


Inferences
Inferences drawn from any of the above information to create a profile about you reflecting your preferences, characteristics, psychological trends, preferences, predispositions, behavior, attitudes, intelligence, abilities, and aptitudes

SleepScore®


Audio, Electric, Visual, or Similar Information
Recording of customer service calls. In-store video recordings.

How Do We Collect Your Information? We collect information directly from you. We may collect this information when you:

  • Visit our stores, events, or websites
  • Register with, or create an account on, our websites or applications
  • Respond to a survey given by or on behalf of us
  • Buy products or services from us, whether online, in-store or at one of our events
  • Contact us by phone, e-mail, online chat, webform or mail
  • File a warranty claim or return or exchange a product
  • Participate in a sweepstakes or similar promotion sponsored by, or in partnership with, us
  • Sign-up to receive emails or text messages from us
  • Leave comments or reviews on our websites
  • Post a photo or other content or send us a message via our channels on social media platforms like Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter
  • If you use the MattressMatcher® application in any of our stores, events or online
  • If you use our Sleep.com mobile app. . You may access the Sleep.com mobile application Privacy Policy here.

We use tracking tools, such as clickstream data, cookies and pixel tags, to collect information from you. The information collected is non-personalized and does not identify you. You may disable some of these tracking tools by managing your cookie preferences on our website. however, if you choose to use our website, you expressly consent to the use of those tracking tools that are necessary for the proper functioning of our websites.

  • Clickstream Data. . We collect clickstream data, which provides a non-personalized record of your activity on the internet using the items and webpages that you click on. . We use this data to analyze how you use our websites.
  • Cookies. . We collect cookies, which are small text files that may be stored on your device when you use our websites.  The cookies we use may contain information – such as a unique user ID – or collect information, such as your email address if you create an account with us on any of our websites.  Cookies allow us to recognize your device when you return to our website. They also help us to understand how you use our website and to provide you with advertising and content that we think may be of interest to you.
  • Pixel Tags. . A pixel tag (also known as a web beacon) is a small string of code that represents a clear graphic image. . We use pixel us to collect non-personalized information about your activity on our website (e.g., time, date, duration, and number of page views), so that we can improve our website functioning and to provide you with advertising and content that we think may be of interest to you.

We allow third-party companies (e.g., Google and PayPal) to place tags on our digital properties. The tags may collect information about your activity on our websites and may be used by these third parties to provide us with data and marketing analytics, to assist us with creating or effecting advertising campaigns, and to assist with order fulfillment. Our Privacy Policy does not cover these third-party companies. Please contact these third-party companies (e.g., Google and PayPal) directly for more information about their privacy policy and your choices regarding the tags and the information collected by the tags.

We may collect information about you from our advertising networks, financing partners, data analytics partners and data brokers. We use information collected for marketing purposes, to analyze and enhance data that we have and for other internal business purposes such as performance optimization.

We may also collect information about you from a friend or family member. A guest may purchase a product and ask that we deliver it to you. A friend may also tag you in one or more of our social media posts to enter into a sweepstakes that we sponsor. How Do We Use Your Information? During the past year, we have used information that we have collected about our guests and others for the following business purposes. We may use the information that we collect about you for the following business purposes:


Business Purpose


Information Used


To complete your purchase and create a record of your sales order.


Name

Postal Address

Telephone number

Email address

Account login – for online purchases

Account password – for online purchases

Record of products or services purchased


To accept and process your payment.

Driver’s license number or state identification card number

Date of birth


To deliver the products and services that you order and to haul-away your unwanted mattress.





Name

Postal address

Email address

Telephone number

Record of products or services purchased


To administer your participation in a sweepstakes, contest or other promotion and report your winnings to a government tax authority.





Name

Postal address

Email address

IP address

Special status designation (e.g., first-responder, military, etc.)

Tax identification number


To market and advertise to you.


We use your information to send you communications about special promotions or offers via regular mail, email and text messaging. We may send you emails if you register on our website or mobile application, Sleep.com, or if you give us your information in one of our stores or pop-up events. We may use information about you collected across different online services and non-affiliated websites and from the various devices you may use, to market to you (including by online ads) based on your interests. For example, if you view a product on our website, you may see ads for that product on our or third-party websites. We also use your information collected from our MattressMatcher® application, Sleep.com mobile application, financing partners and data and analytics partners to make product, service and content recommendations to you.

We may use your information across all of our brands (e.g., Sleep Experts, Mattress Firm and Sleep.com).

Internet or other electronic network activity information, including, but not limited to, browsing time, browsing history, search history, and information regarding your interaction with an internet web site, application, or advertisement

Inferences drawn from any of the information that we collect about you to create a profile about you reflecting your preferences, characteristics, psychological trends, preferences, predispositions, behavior, attitudes, intelligence, abilities, and aptitudes


To provide you with customer service (e.g., warranty claims, exchanges, returns, store locator, answering your questions, etc.).


Name

Records of products or services purchased, obtained, or other purchasing or consuming histories or tendencies

Internet or other electronic network activity information, including, but not limited to, browsing time, browsing history, search history, and information regarding your interaction with an internet web site, application, or advertisement


To survey you about your experience with us.





Name

To detect and prevent fraud and criminal activity and to administer our loss prevention program.


We may use your information to protect you and our company, customers, and employees. For example, we collect your signature upon product delivery to establish proof of delivery. . We also track your browsing behavior on our websites, and verify information that you provide at checkout, to detect and prevent fraud. . If you decide to pick up your purchase in-person, we may ask to see your drivers’ license (but will not store a copy of it) to confirm that the person picking up the order is the person that placed the order. If you refuse to show us your license, we may collect your vehicle’s license plate number to establish, as part of our loss prevention program, a record of who picked up the product. . We may also use cameras in our stores to administer our loss prevention program.

Signature

Postal address

Driver’s license number or state identification card number

Geolocation data (not more precise than zip code)

Internet or other electronic network activity information, including, but not limited to, browsing time, browsing history, search history, and information regarding your interaction with an internet web site, application, or advertisement


To conduct internal research and data analytics.


We may use information collected about you to conduct research for purposes of improving our merchandising, sales, marketing, customer experience and real estate strategies and to evaluate our performance. . We may use information collected about your behavior on our websites and applications and your purchase history to make improvements to our websites, applications, stores and our product and service offerings.

Inferences drawn from any of the information that we collect about you to create a profile about you reflecting your preferences, characteristics, psychological trends, preferences, predispositions, behavior, attitudes, intelligence, abilities, and aptitudes


To pay you for goods and services that you provide or to otherwise pay what we owe to you.


If you are a vendor or landlord that is a natural person, we collect your personal information so that we can verify your payment information, report payments that we make to you to the applicable taxing authority (e.g., IRS) and to remit payment to you. If you win a prize under a sweepstakes that we sponsor, we may collect your tax identification number to report your winnings to the applicable taxing authority.

To communicate with you for business-to-business purposes.

How Long Do We Keep Your Information? We keep your information as long as we reasonably anticipate needing it to comply with applicable law, to enforce our rights and to support our ongoing business relationship with you, in accordance with our policies. As an example, if you have purchased a product from us, we anticipate that we may need your personal information to:

  • Meet your reasonably anticipated customer service needs (e.g., providing copies of sales receipts and responding to questions that you may have regarding the merchandise and services that you ordered).
  • Assist you with any current or future warranty claims.  Please note that the products that we offer often come with warranties that last several years from the date of original purchase.
  • Process returns and/or fulfill exchanges.
  • Contact you in the event of a product recall or other issue relating to the product or services that you have purchased.

So that we may continue to market and advertise to you, we will not remove you from our marketing list unless you unsubscribe from all marketing communications from us or ask that we delete your information from our records. How Do We Share Your Information? We may share information that we collect about you for our business purposes and as legally required or permitted.

With our Service Providers.

We may share information that we collect about you with companies that provide us with services in support of our ongoing operations. For example, we allow our fraud prevention vendor, Forter, Inc., to collect information about your activity on our websites, as well as information you may provide at checkout, to detect and prevent fraud. We may also share information about you with payment processors, delivery routers, contractors and schedulers, shippers, product suppliers, product order processors, technical service vendors, companies that conduct surveys on our behalf, and companies, like direct mail providers, that help us market our products and services. These companies must agree to appropriate restrictions on the protection and use of your personal information.

With our Advertisers and Marketers.

We may share your information with advertising and marketing partners to provide you with targeted advertising and promotions and to enable you to give us feedback about the products that you purchase from us. For more details, please see the section of this Privacy Policy titled, “Third Party Advertising Partners and Targeted Advertising”.

With our Financing and Leasing Partners.

We may share your information with our financing and leasing partners to prescreen you for financing and leasing offers that we may communicate to you. Also, if you purchase a product from us using your Mattress Firm credit card or other financing or leasing applied for in-store, online or at one of our pop-up events, we inform the applicable finance or leasing company of your sales order information. We may also share your information to resolve chargebacks, disputes, errors and fraudulent activity associated with your financing or leasing account.

With our Suppliers.

In instances where we do not administer a product’s warranty, we may provide your information to the supplier of the product so that your warranty claim can be handled. We may also share information with our suppliers to respond to your reviews and questions about their products and services. If a supplier is responsible for directly shipping an ordered product to you, we provide your order and contact information to the supplier so that the product can be delivered to you.

With Government Authorities.

We may share your information as required or requested by a governmental agency (e.g., to respond to a court order or subpoena and report payments to applicable taxing authorities).

With Law Enforcement and Collection Agencies.

We may disclose your information to law enforcement if we suspect fraud. We may also share your information as part of an investigation or to report actual or suspected criminal activity. We may disclose your information to assist us in collecting a debt owed to us by you.

With Strategic Business Partners.

As we continue to develop our business, we or our affiliates may sell or buy other businesses or entities. In such transactions, your information may be one of the transferred business assets.

At Your Direction.

We may share your information as requested by you.
How is Your Information Sold or Shared under the CCPA? During the past year, we have Sold or Shared the following information that we have collected about our guests and others who reside in California. Please note that in this section of our Privacy Policy, “Sold” and “Shared” have the meanings given to them by the California Consumer Privacy Act.

Categories of Personal Information Sold or Shared

  • Internet or other electronic network activity (e.g., collected by cookies and pixel tags)
  • Identifiers (e.g., name, postal address, email address, telephone number)
  • Commercial Information (e.g., products or services purchased, purchase history)

Categories of Third Parties to Whom Personal Information was Sold or Shared

  • Advertising Networks
  • Data Analytics Providers
  • Data Brokers
  • Merchandise Suppliers
Third Party Advertising Partners and Your Privacy Preferences We use third-party advertising partners to serve advertisements on our behalf across the Internet. These advertising partners may collect information about your visits to our website, and your interactions with our products and services, so that we can provide you with advertising and product recommendations tailored to your interests. The information is collected through the use of cookies and pixel tags. In addition to the information about your visits to our website, our advertising partners may also use information about your activities and behavior on other websites and online applications to assist us with “Targeted Advertising”. Targeted Advertising means displaying an advertisement to you where the advertisement is chosen based on information obtained from your activities over time and across non-affiliated websites and online applications for purposes of predicting your preferences or interests. For example, our advertising partners may use information about your visits to websites and online applications that are not affiliated with Mattress Firm to serve you with advertisements for Mattress Firm products and services that align with your interests.

If you would like to opt-out of Targeted Advertising, as described above, submit your request online, or send a written request to: “Mattress Firm, 10201 S. Main Street, Houston, TX 77025, Attn: Legal Department”. If submitting a written request, please include your name, mailing address, telephone number and email address.

Currently, we use third party-placed tracking pixels and cookies from the following advertising delivery partner(s): Google. In the future we may partner with other companies to provide interest-based advertising, both on and off our websites. If this occurs, Mattress Firm provides you with an opportunity to opt out when these advertisements are served. You may manage your third-party advertising preferences by clicking on the links below:

  • I would like to opt OUT of Google Analytics Display Advertising.

If you would like more information about this practice and to know your choices for not having this information used by third-party service providers, please visit http://www.networkadvertising.org/managing/opt_out.asp

Facebook Custom Audience Ads

We may display interest-based ads to you when you are using Facebook through a tool offered by Facebook called the Custom Audience Tool. This tool allows us to personalize our ads based on your shopping experience with us. We do not share personalized information or your shopping history with Facebook. The tool lets Mattress Firm convert your e-mail address to a unique number that Facebook uses to match to unique numbers Facebook generates from e-mail addresses of its users.

  • I would like to opt OUT of Facebook Custom Audience ads.

Google Custom Match Ads

We may display interest-based ads to you when you are using Google through a tool offered by Google called the Custom Match Program. This tool allows us to personalize our ads based on your shopping experience with us. The tool lets Mattress Firm convert your e-mail address to a unique number that Google uses to match to unique numbers Google generates from e-mail addresses of its users.

  • I would like to opt OUT of Google Custom Match ads.

E-mail Marketing

If you are opted in to receive marketing e-mails from us and wish to unsubscribe, you can do so by clicking on the Unsubscribe hyperlink at the bottom of the marketing e-mail you receive. You may also choose to opt out of e-mails by sending an e-mail to us at customerservice@mattressfirm.com. If you choose to opt out with this method, please be sure to include the e-mail address that you would like us to unsubscribe.
Your California Privacy Rights If you are a California resident, the below information applies to you. Certain terms used in this section have the meanings given to them under the California Consumer Privacy Act (“CCPA”).

Shine the Light

Pursuant to Section 1798.83 of the California Civil Code, if you have an established business relationship with a business, you have the right to request from that business, certain information with respect to the types of personal information that business shares with third parties for those third parties' direct marketing purposes and the identities of the third parties with whom that business has shared such information during the immediately preceding calendar year. Submit your request here.

Please note that under California law, businesses are only required to respond to a Shine the Light request once during any calendar year.

California Consumer Privacy Act

Pursuant to Sections 1798.110 and 1798.115 of the California Civil Code, you have the right to request that a business disclose to you the following:

(1) The categories of personal information it has collected about you;

(2) The categories of sources from which the personal information is collected;

(3) The business or commercial purpose for collecting, selling or sharing personal information;

(4) The categories of third parties to whom the business discloses personal information;

(5) The specific pieces of personal information it has collected about you;

(6) The categories of personal information that the business sold or shared about you, if any, and the categories of third parties to whom the personal information was sold or shared, by category or categories of personal information for each category of third party to whom the personal information was sold or shared. and

(7) The categories of personal information that the business disclosed about you for a business purpose, if any, and the categories of persons to whom your personal information was disclosed for a business purpose.

Pursuant to Section 1798.105 of the California Civil Code, you have the right to request that a business delete any personal information about you which the business has collected from you.

Pursuant to Section 1798.106 of the California Code, you have the right to request that a business that maintains inaccurate personal information about you, correct such inaccurate information.

Pursuant to Section 1798.121 of the California Code, you have the right to request that a business that collects sensitive personal information about you to limit its use of your sensitive personal information to that which is necessary to perform the services or provide the goods requested by you.

To exercise any of these rights, you may submit your request online, or send a written request to: “Mattress Firm, 10201 S. Main Street, Houston, TX 77025, Attn: Legal Department”. If submitting a written request, please include your name, mailing address, telephone number and email address.

Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information

Pursuant to Section 1798.120 of the California Civil Code, you have the right, at any time, to direct a business that sells or shares your personal information to not do so, even if no money is exchanged. To exercise this right and opt out of the “sale” and “shar[ing]” (as such terms are defined under the CCPA) of your information, submit your request online, or send a written request to: “Mattress Firm, 10201 S. Main Street, Houston, TX 77025, Attn: Legal Department”. If submitting a written request, please include your name, mailing address, telephone number and email address.

No business may discriminate against you on account of your exercise of these rights. For Nevada Residents Mattress Firm does not sell your personally identifiable information in exchange for money. However, if you would like to opt-out of the sale of your personally identifiable information, submit your request online, or send a written request to: “Mattress Firm, 10201 S. Main Street, Houston, TX 77025, Attn: Legal Department”. If submitting a written request, please include your name, mailing address, telephone number and email address. For All of Our Guests You may request that we:

  • Confirm if we are processing your personal information
  • Correct inaccuracies in your personal information
  • Delete any personal information about you which we have collected
  • Provide you with a portable copy of the personal information we have collected about you
  • Opt you out of the sale of your personal information to third parties
  • Opt you out of Targeted Advertising (please see the section of this Privacy Policy titled “Third Party Advertising Partners and Targeted Advertising” for detail on how we use Targeted Advertising)
  • Opt you of the processing of your personal information in furtherance of decisions that produce legal or similarly significant effects on you.

If you would like to exercise any of these choices, submit your request online, or send a written request to: “Mattress Firm, 10201 S. Main Street, Houston, TX 77025, Attn: Legal Department”. If submitting a written request, please include your name, mailing address, telephone number and email address. Appeals If you would like to appeal any decision that we make with respect to any request that you have submitted regarding your personal information, please submit your request online, or send a written request, noting your appeal, to: “Mattress Firm, 10201 S. Main Street, Houston, TX 77025, Attn: Legal Department”. If submitting a written request, please include your name, mailing address, telephone number and email address. Changes to this Privacy Policy We may change this Privacy Policy from time to time.

If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at customerservice@mattressfirm.com. Actions

For the first 3 months, the monthly payment will be equal to $1. For the next 33 months, a higher monthly payment will be required equal to any remaining promo purchase balance divided by the number of months remaining in the applicable promo period, rounded up to the next whole dollar. Except for the first 3 months, these payments may be higher than the payments that would be required if this purchase was a non-promo purchase. Regular account terms apply to non-promo purchases.
